Paragraph.Text: AX0001/24 AIC RESTRICTION EDDB/BERLIN/BRANDENBURG VALIDITY: 25JAN24-UFN HANDLING OF ARR AND DEP AT EDDB 1.1 ASSIGNMENT OF THE TKOF RWY: THE ASSIGNMENT OF THE RWY FOR TKOF IS BASED ON THE FLW CONSIDERATIONS: -DEP FM THE ACFT STANDS ON APN 1, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 3B, 4, A AND E AND THE ACFT STANDS B01 TO B04 AND D01 TO D07 WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RUNWAY 07L/25R. -ALL OTHER DEP WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 07R/25L. 1.2 USE OF DEP RTE: FOR TKOF FM RWY 07L AND 07R, CIRCUMSTANCES REQUIRE AN INCREASED CLIMB GRADIENT (PROC DESIGN GRADIENT, PDG) TO BE MNTN ON THE NOISE-OPTIMISED DEP RTE. DUE TO THE HIGH NOISE SENSITIVITY, ALL FLT THAT CAN COMPLY WITH THESE GRADIENTS MUST, PLAN THE FLW DEP RTE: -DEP FM RWY 07L ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF SUKIP OR LOGDO WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID B. -DEP FM RWY 07R ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF SUKIP OR LOGDO WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID Q. CK PRIOR DEP NECESSARILY THE COMPLIANCE WITH THE RESTRICTION AT POBAM (F100+). IF UNA ADZ ATC PRIOR DEP IN DUE TIME. -DEP FM RWY 07R ON DEP RTE IN THE DIRECTION OF GERGA, ARSAP OR LUROS WILL USE RTE WITH THE ID Q. IF, FOR AERODYNAMIC OR MET REASONS, AN ACFT PILOT IS UNA TO FULFIL THE CLIMB GRADIENT SPECIFIED IN THE DEP RTE, THIS SHALL BE COMMUNICATED AT THE START-UP APPROVAL. ONLY IN SUCH CASES DFS WILL THEN GIVE THE CLR FOR THE ALTERNATIVE DEP RTE. 1.3 INDEPENDENT DEP OPS USUALLY, TKOF FM BOTH PARL RWY TAKE PLACE INDEPENDENTLY OF EACH OTHER. CARE MUST BE TAKEN TO COMPLY WITH THE PROC EXACTLY. ANY DEVIATIONS, ESPECIALLY IN THE DIRECTION OF THE PARL RWY, MUST BE AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS. THIS ALSO APPLIES TO DEVIATIONS DUE TO MET REASONS, WHICH MAY ONLY TAKE PLACE AFT CONSULTATION WITH ATC. 2.1 ASSIGNMENT OF LDG RWY: THE ASSIGNMENT OF THE RWY FOR THE APCH IS BASED ON THE FLW CONSIDERATIONS: APCH FM THE ACFT STANDS ON APN 1, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 3B,4, A AND E AND THE ACFT STANDS B01 TO B04 AND D01 TO D07 WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RUNWAY 07L/25R. ALL OTHER APCH WILL ALWAYS BE ASSIGNED RWY 07R/25L. DEPENDING ON THE TFC SITUATION, DEVIATIONS FM THIS DISTRIBUTIONARE POSS, ESPECIALLY IN TERMS OF LOAD BALANCING. 2.2 CHANGING FREQ TO BERLIN DIRECTOR: WHEN CHANGING FREQUENCIES FM BREMEN RADAR TO BERLIN DIRECTOR, THE INITIAL CALL SHALL BE RESTRICTED TO THE CALL SIGN TO AVOID FREQ CONGESTION. 2.3 INDEPENDENT APCH OPS AS A RULE, APCH WILL BE PERFORMED IN INDEPENDENT PARL APCH OPS. THIS WILL BE ANNOUNCED THRU THE ATIS ON THE FREQ 123.780 MHZ.
TWY N1 CLSD ABM ACFT STAND 64.

AIRCRAFT WITH RADIO FAILURE MUST OPERATE AS FOLLOWS: DEPARTING AIRCRAFT CONTINUE STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13
